mets:xmlData.dc:subject: Caralambo, George, 1828-1913
mets:xmlData.dc:description: Image depicts memorial gravemarker for the camel driver Greek George. Marker reads: "Greek George, born in Smyrna as George Caralambo came to this country as a camel driver for the United States Government in 1857. Naturalized--George Allen in 1867. Died Spet. 2, 1913 at Old Mission. Historical marker erected by Whittier Parlor No. 298 Native Daughters of the Golden West, Courtesy of F. G. Simmons and R.D. White June 30,1956."
mets:xmlData.dc:title: Greek George Memorial
mets:xmlData.dc:source: Selected photograph from the Whittier History Room photograph collection.
